Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: leslie z
Reviews.Content: The room was kind of small but very clean. The hotel offers complementary cold and hot breakfast and it was actually pretty good. They have free parking and it is located right off the freeway close to a Walmart and a few attractions. It was affordable and pretty good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Ness C
Reviews.Content: The room was nice enough and it actually did have everything I wanted on first impressions. I stayed 3 nights and it was in staying longer that the gaps started to appear. Firstly, the Continental Breakfast was nice until I realised that I needed to buy my own paper bowls and plates to use as the PLASTIC plates provided melted with a warm/hot piece of toast. Next when we came back after a day out, we found that although they provided a daily room service this meant that they removed the garbage, made your bed, BUT they also took the soap you had only just opened and didn't replace it. This was the same for the coffee. I was not impressed. So it was OK, but I would not stay there again. It is sad because I really enjoy MOST Best Westerns.

Reviews.Title: “O.k.stay”
Reviews.Author: Leentje_11
Reviews.Content: Easy acces to this hotel. Average room. Very helpfull frontdesk personnel. The BW is located opposite of some restaurants. There is a great Chinese buffet restaurant. Very very good. There is a guest laundry.It is a ok room for a good price. The hotel is aside a busy road. But we slept o.k. No problem. There are also rooms at the back. Enough variety of breakfast. Very good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a budget motel”
Reviews.Author: TucsonWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: We typically stay at another favorite hotel nearby in Kearney-Mesa but was unable to so this was the backup. The pros: A friendly young man checked us in and the bed was comfortable. The motel is dated but my room was exceptionally clean. These three reasons are why the hotel has been rated average. The cons: Traffic can be heard; didn't like the flimsy window next to the door and flimsy 1980s dated chain lock on the door; could easily hear both sets of my neighbors on either side of the room; the breakfast was terrible, which is frustrating since how can you mess up cereal and milk? Overall, I did not feel safe as I typically do in San Diego and did not feel like relaxation was a possibility given the surroundings. If you are looking for a clean motel, and one that you drive your car up to the door and don't mind a room without updated locks, you will enjoy this motel.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok!”
Reviews.Author: Joanmaya
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 2nd floor. The room was clean. It's in great location and didn't hear any traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible: NOISY, DIRTY, no service, did not feel safe”
Reviews.Author: vorsoni
Reviews.Content: When I go to San Diego for a TV show I usually stay at my fave hotel around this area but because of the ComiCon could not get a room. I ended up finding that the only hotel with availabilities was this one. No wonder! This must be a former lousy motel transformed into a Best Western. Check in was barely ok though the lady in attendance seemed so bored that it made the experience even worse. My room was on the 3rd floor overlooking the back of the hotel/motel, so as to avoid noise as much as possible. But these rooms are so poorly insulated that I could hear everything....It seemed the traffic was going through my bathroom. If you are cold or hot and turn the heating/AC on the noise is so loud there is no way one can fall asleep. The carpet needed cleaning and I am not sure how often the bed covers are cleaned. As I did not manage to sleep at all during one of my worst hotel night ever I would definitely NOT recommend this hotel to anybody. ps: one good point: wifi was free

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mypctechs
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a no-frills affordable place to stay for my family during a visit to San Diego. This hotel did not let me down. It was quiet, in a pretty nice area, and close to everything we wanted to see. The price was amazing and I got more than everything I expected from my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: TheDutchOne
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Golden Triangle Inn. We drove from L.A. to San Diego (which took us 5 hours due to heavy traffic!!) just to see the San Diego Zoo and after that to be on our way to our next stop. The room wasn't that big, but it was clean. The bed was really nice. Requested a room on 2nd or 3rd floor and got a room on the 3rd, as requested. It's right next to the 805, but you don't hear any traffic at all. Breakfast is till 9.30AM. We got in the lobby at 9AM, but most food was already gone and even after 15 minutes was not restocked, except for the juices. So I took the last sweet thing and a glass of orange juice and that was my breakfast. The breakfast was the only downside on this stay. Oh yeah, and the lack of a swimmingpool. But that's something you know when making a reservation. For a short trip to San Diego this is a nice place, when I would stay longer, I would have looked for a hotel/motel with a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very roomy. Had a wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: mjassbong
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Golden Triangle Inn on Saturday night to attend the 2010 MCAS Airshow the next morning on Sunday. Overall it was a very pleasant stay. Checking in was a breeze and the staff at the frond desk were very courteous and helpful. I got a corner room on the ground level and it was very roomy, clean and quiet. BW Golden Triangle Inn is just off the 805, so it is easy access to the San Diego metro areas. Best of all, it is only a few exits away from MCAS in Miramar.

Reviews.Title: “ok if you are on a budget and like rock hard beds”
Reviews.Author: macleanbs
Reviews.Content: This was the first and the last time I will stay at a Best Western.The room was clean and quiet but the beds were the worst I have ever slept in. Unless you like a bed that is rock hard I would look for somewhere else to stay. The Air conditioning barely worked as well.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: matty4unet
Reviews.Content: Was happy with the hotel, wudnt recommend it if yer staying for more than 2 or 3 days and i wudnt recomend it for honeymooners or people who like a fancy restaurant, but we wanted sumwhere for a couple of nights while waiting to catch a cruise and we cant grumble, rooms where big and spacy, shower was awesome, one of the best iv used in my life, i want one for back home, had massager and everything, the location was the down point and its a taxi only type hotel for traveliing, no buses or shuttles run near the hotel, we went across the road to a takeaway type italian but they had sitting inside and for 6 dollars we got 1 portion of chicken fingers and chips between us and it was enough to fill us both so spot on. There are shops further down the road aswell. If you wanna go sumwhere awesome get a taxi to Pacific Beach, its the closest beach and will cost you 20 dollars in a taxi. beautiful place, you can walk to the left and so the beach is on your right and there are loads of millionaire beach houses that are amazing, Theres also an amuzement park fuirther down with a surf rider that worht a looking. As for the hotel, i cant grumble, our 2 days where pleasant, the breakfast was spot on, no hot food but there were lots of croisants and cereal and orange juice and u can have as much as you like. Taxi to the cruise port if yer interested was 30 dollars and it was same from the train station to the hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Loved”
Reviews.Author: snowbird2008
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel with free internet. Front desk was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “" A Splendid Summer Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: SL_TX88
Reviews.Content: It was a splendid summer vacation that my cousin’s family and I took in California. After surfing around the web, we chose to stay at the Best Western Golden Triangle Inn for 4 days and 3 nights while in San Diego. The staff was cordial and had us checked in within 5 minutes. Upon entering our room, I noticed that it very clean and neat, which is a must have criteria for me. The room we stayed in had two king beds, a mini-fridge and a 25” TV, along with the baby crib we requested. With all the furniture, appliances and our luggage, the room became a bit cramped, even though it is a larger room compare to most motels I stayed at during our CA trip. The bed I had was comfortable and I was able to relax after full days at Sea World and Legoland. The motel is conveniently located with various types of restaurants and grocery stores nearby. We counted no less than 30 restaurants and fast food joints within 10 minutes driving distance. We took advantage of the complimentary breakfast which consisted of muffins, coffee, cereals, fresh orange juice, milk and boiled eggs. The kids enjoyed the breakfast; I’d probably have had outside breakfast for a change if staying longer than a week. I would stay there again if traveling to San Diego with my friends or family. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning travel to San Diego. My ratings for this hotel are: Value: 4 Room: 4 Cleanliness: 5 Service: 4 Would I recommend this hotel to my friends or family members? Yes I recommend this hotel to Families, business travelers, tourists I would not recommend this hotel to Honeymoon couples seeking a romantic setting Date of Stay: 6/27/2007 to 6/30/2007 Traveled with: Cousin’s family Age Group: 2 to 34

Reviews.Title: “Great place for great price”
Reviews.Author: AZNatureLover
Reviews.Content: The place is convinienty located off highway 805. Rooms are clean, staff is couteous and morning break-fast is superb. I had forgotten razor, so when I asked about it at the front desk, the person checked with me if I would like the shaving cream too. That was good to go that extra step to satisfy customers. Break-fast is much better than most other places - quantity and quality of everything they had was more than satisfactory. The only compaint I have is their pillows are huge and hard, so it left my neck uncomortable. They don't have any software or smaller pillows as replacements. Barring that complaint, I was very happy with our stay for two nights. I recommend the place to anyone going to SD area. We went to Sea World, and the hotel is barely 10 minutes drive. Oh one more thing - great restaurants are nearby, so that is very convinient, too! For vegetarians, there is a vegetarian fusion cafe across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated Experience”
Reviews.Author: LOLI1707
Reviews.Content: We arrived sooner than check-in time, and indeed they made us wait until a little before 3 pm before we could get our room. So no early arrivals. Once we got our room keys, we made our way to the second floor via elavator (we were too lazy to walk up the stairs). The room was nice and clean, the bed was a little on the hard side, and I believe because of the renovations, some of the screws to things were loose, the chrome shower fixtures I tightened as much as I could with my hand, the toilet seat moved, and I also noticed toward the end of our stay that the door security latch was loose, which was a bit scary considering many rely on it for safety, I tightened that with tweezers. The parking is narrow like others have said and I found the walls to be too thin. Coming and going from the hotel is a pain in the rear, depending on what direction your headed, everytime we headed back to hotel we had to jump on 805 freeway and make a loop to get back to the other side of the road. Overall the experience at this hotel was good one, if your going to be out of the room most of the day, this is the place for you. I did feel safe and many of the other occupants were groups of families. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous Parking”
Reviews.Author: JCsWomyn
Reviews.Content: You get even less than what you pay for. Yes, this is a clean budget hotel. The rooms are smaller than average, the beds are uncomfortable, but that is to be expected given the price you pay. The real problem with this hotel is that the parking is not only horrendous but DANGEROUS. There is one opening into the parking lot and the width of the actual space between rows is smaller than average. It took about 10 minutes to get in and out of a parking space with a compact car. This is because you simply cannot pull into a space, without doing various back and forth manuevers to make sure you don't hit either the cars on either side or the ones behind you. In addition, while advertising a free continental breakfast, if you aren't up at 6 AM don't count on seeing it. We went to it at right before 8 AM and it was completely GONE, not even any coffee left. Yet, the management was aware that the hotel was full, but they just put a set amount out and that was it. The only plus I have for this hotel is that IS clean, and the free wireless internet is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basically a Motel 6 with gold colored paint. The rooms were musty smelling and small. They didn't have any soap, shampoo's, extra towels, etc...I would not recommend staying here. True it's close to the freeways, but that's about it. Their pics and summary are misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: wdl
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more even with the relatively low rates (paid about $100 in early October). The reception was ok, not big quibbles, the guy who did our checkin was quite helpful. The location was quite decent, although I find quite easy to miss the entrance: it is right at the intersection of two freeways and if you are coming from the overpass, you have to slow down and merge immediately to your right, which I find annoying, not too mention somehow unsafe. Rooms were supposed to be renovated, but they still gave a feeling of a 1 star hotel. What I mean is that the room just feels "cheap" considering it is a 2 star hotel. In fact, even "renovated," I would say it is a more of a 1.5 or a 1 star than a 2 stars hotel. Breakfast is just danish and coffee - and not very good, I might add. It was not terrible, but I feel the hotel needs more realistic reviews to knock down the 4.0 score, which is unfair to the really great hotels out there where the management goes into great efforts to make your stay feels memorable. As a side note, California Suites, 2 blocks away, has a better rate and a much better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The power of Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: silverjym
Reviews.Content: Good freeway access. Easy to get to La Jolla or Mission Bay. Room good size, clean, somewhat worn. Parking for cars only, no cars with trailers. No view, no pool. Second floor, end units best. Standard Danish and coffee breakfast. Requested non-smoking room, room reeked of smoke. Use Febreeze. Receptionist was having protracted argument with both customers in line ahead of me. Expedia had not forwarded their reservations. Instead of trying to solve this issue, she was sarcastic and very argumentative with them. When I walked up to her, her greeting consisted of "What's your name?" With no further word, she located my reservation, literally tossed my keys to me and disappeared into the back office. So much for a welcoming greeting. The room has a cube refrigerator (you defrost),TV, tub and shower, pretty basic Best Western stuff. The bed was made without a fitted bottom sheet. The maid used a top sheet for the bottom sheet (top sheets are smaller than bottom sheets). Naturally, whenever I rolled over the bottom sheet came undone and in short order wrapped around me. Impossible to sleep as everytime I rolled over I had to reset the bottom sheet. I mentioned this to the front desk the next morning and they said they would have the maid put a fitted sheet on. That evening I discovered she again used a top sheet and shorted the sheet so that a good third of the end of the mattress had no bottom sheet. I re-made the bed. Next morning, same promise. I asked to be given the bottom sheet, I would put it on myself. I was handed a mattress pad. I asked the receptionist if her life depended on it, could she tell me what it was. She said she did not know. So much for knowledgeable staff. She suggested that if I wanted a fitted bottom sheet I should go to Walmart and buy one. That's just what I did. On leaving I mentioned that I was really put off by the reception I received and the bed linens. The response I got was basically, "Yeah, that's too bad". Then inspiration struck: I told them I was going to review their hotel on Travel Advisor. Almost INSTANTLY the manager/franchise owner appeared. After listening to my concerns with an obviously well practiced show of well practiced professional sympathy he offered to take 10% off my bill, which covered the cost of buying a fitted bottom sheet. I asked him if he thought it was inappropriate for hotel guests to provide their own linens. He stated that "No Best Western provides fitted bottom sheets". Of course his statement is nonsense. In checking with Best Western's corporate offices they said each Best Western is individually owned and the bedding type is determined by each owner. The customer service rep seemed taken aback that they were using top sheets instead of fitted bottom sheets. The owner's explaination of the rude reception I received was "Well, that's a good reason not to make your reservation through the internet". Huh? I told him I made my reservation directly through his hotel and still received a rude reception. I understand it's not the Four Seasons, but his staff is still presumptively in the hospitality business, they just don't know this. So, if you want reasonably priced, good location-- bring your own sheets, know how to defrost a refrigerator and be prepared for anything from rude to indifferent service from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Clean, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Golden Triangle Inn for 2 nights while our house was being tented for termites. I didn't have high expecations, but it turned out to be a very comfortable stay. The room was very clean. It showed a little wear-n-tear, but not much. The TV worked perfectly, nice clear picture and the mini-fridge looked almost new. There was an attempt to have some attractive art on the walls. The bed - a king - was very firm and comfortable with three big fluffy pillows. The air conditioning worked well, and was fairly quiet. The water pressure was good and the showerhead was far enough up the wall that my tall husband could fit. (I hate the low motel showerheads!) Although there were noisy kids staying next door, once they were inside their room you couldn't hear them through the walls. There is a small table and two chairs in the room, so you can grab a quick bite, or spread out your laptop. The staff was friendly. The young woman working the desk when I checked in was very pleasant and professional. When I later came down for an extra towel, she cheerfully gave me a whole stack. I didn't take advantage of the free breakfast, but it's served daily from 6:30-9:30 AM. There is a small dining room just off the reception desk. There's also one outside table where you can sit and eat/rest, but it's right next to the entrance and a busy road, so I couldn't say it was scenic. The Inn was recently bought out by Best Western and there aren't good signs out yet, so it's easy to miss. I pulled into the Motel 6 next door by accident, and my husband, who came seperately, missed the entrance. The hotel sits right next to I-805, so it's very easy to get anywhere you want to go. Within a 5 minute drive away are a large variety of restaurants - mostly fast food and small local places - so there's no need to eat at the place across the street (which isn't so great). I personally recommend Lolitta's Taco Shop about a 1/2 mile away; a hole-in-the-wall, but best Mexican in San Diego. Overall, the Golden Triangle Inn was a clean, comfortable stay. I would recommend it if you're looking for a budget motel.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Golden Triangle Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 5550 Clairemont Mesa Blvd, San Diego, CA 92117
